DOC.brief_summary: Characterize express blood volume ≥1μL across representative , commercially available lance device system use finger stick .
DOC.brief_title: The Characterization Blood Volumes Commercially Available Lancing Devices
DOC.detailed_description: Primary Objective : • Characterize express blood volume ≥1μL across representative , commercially available lance device system use finger stick . Secondary Objectives : follow characterization perform data analysis within device across device : - Correlation Subject pain response blood volume collect ; - Proportion Subjects produce sufficient blood fill 1µl test strip ; - Proportion Subjects generate ≥1µl blood volume ; - Proportion Subjects generate multiple- time blood volume need fill 1µl test strip - Proportion Subjects generate multiple- time ≥1µl blood volume - Proportion Subjects produce average ( ≥1µl ) blood volume 1st attempt - Proportion Subjects produce average ( ≥1µl ) blood volume first second lancing attempt
DOC.criteria: Must diagnose type 1 type 2 diabetes one ( 1 ) year ( ) . Must currently selfmonitoring blood glucose level least 6 month . Must selftest least 2 time daily . Must age 18 75 participate . Subjects must able perform task require protocol . Subjects must willing complete study procedure . Subjects must able speak , read understand English understand Informed Consent document . Subjects neuropathy nerve damage hand finger ( discover monofilament test ) Subjects take prescription anticoagulant one full aspirin per day past week clot problem may prolong bleeding ( person take Plavix daily low dose aspirin exclude record ) . Subjects take pain reliever within 24 hour . Subjects hemophilia bleed disorder . Subjects infection blood borne pathogen ( e.g. , HIV , hepatitis ) . Subjects condition cognitive disorder , opinion Investigator would put person risk seriously compromise integrity study ( PI sign Case Report Form Subject exclude ) . Subjects work Facet , LifeScan Inc. , competitive company . Subjects miss digit . Subjects pregnant nursing . Subjects chemotherapy .
